hint.text: Remember that the force equation has two factors(Mass and Acceleration) and that the mass factor has a greater absolute value.

solution.text:
Force \(=x^3-2x^2y+_{j}_xy^2-_{{2*j}}_y^3\)
\(=x^2(x-2y)+_{j}_y^2(x-2y)\)
\(=(x^2+_{j}_y^2)(x-2y)=\)Mass \(\times\) Acceleration
Since mass has a larger absolute value,
Mass\(=(x^2+_{j}_y^2)\)

content.text:
You are a junior scientist at the Indian Space Research Organisation(ISRO) and are working on a physics formula to predict the force on the space shuttle when it is climbing into the atmosphere.
You know that Force \(=\) Mass \(\times\) Acceleration and you are also told that the equation for the force on the shuttle is Force \(=x^3-2x^2y+_{j}_xy^2-_{{2*j}}_y^3\).
Given that the mass is a larger value than the acceleration(in absolute terms), what is the equation for the mass?
